creator: m.amardeep@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 28035
linux log file

When a log file generated from the linux and windows is compared there is a difference i.e a special character is being added in lost column for every row in the linux log file. how ever this in only visible in the notepad not with any other editors

I am attaching both windows and linux log file

I have not changed any other setting other than these fields enabling in jmeter.properties file.

Note : When this csv log file is opened in open office or excel and re-saving with or with out changes this special character gets escaped.

creator: m.amardeep@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 28036
windows

adding windows log file

Text files created on Linux use <LF> as the end of line (EOL).
Windows text files use <CRLF>.

This is normal OS-dependedent behaviour; if copying files between OSes you need to ensure that you adjust the EOL marker if necessary.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
is there a way to adjust the EOL marker in jmeter.property file which sets to automatically to the CRLF? Please let me know if this is possible.

Requirement: I am downloading Log file from lonux to windows machine, so how to eliminate LF in log file.

Thanks
Hades
creator: m.amardeep@gmail.com
